alert.note: Alert for Eastern King and Queen; Gloucester; Mathews; Middlesex (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 08 at 9:06PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Gloucester, southwestern Middlesex, southeastern King and Queen and northern Mathews Counties through 1000 PM EDT... At 905 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Glenns, or near Urbanna, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Urbanna and Saluda around 910 PM EDT. Glenns around 915 PM EDT. Hartfield around 940 PM EDT. Gloucester Courthouse around 950 PM EDT. Hayes and Blakes around 1000 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Beulah, Naxera, Harmony Village, Grafton, Harcum, Cash, Mattaponi, Warner, Mascot and Fort Nonsense. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Eastern King and Queen; Gloucester; Mathews; Middlesex
